result.execSummary:
All charges against August J. Belling in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. August J. Belling is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:01 AM in Room 301. Defendant August J. Belling in court. Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Hearing is for motion to dismiss. State gives reasoning, has complied with victim rights. Victim does not wish to make statement. No objection by Def. The Court grants State's motion to dismiss. Bond to be returned to poster. State requests dismissal be without prejudice. Court dismisses case without prejudice.

01:16 PM Defendant August J. Belling in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Victim is present in courtroom. CC notes motion to dismiss.  State request to adjourn hearing and be set for new date. Bond continues  Motion hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:22 PM Defendant August J. Belling in court, in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  August J. Belling appeared by video means.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is undecided on atty. State gives bail/bond recommendation and request $50,000 cash bond no contact with victim or residence except one time to get belonging.  Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff Dept and not leave State of WI. Def. heard on bond.  Victim is present in courtroom and State has complied with victim rights. Court orders $10,000  cash bond with conditions No contact with victim or residence & under 940.47(3)except with law enforcement a one time to get belonging.  Keep address current with Clerk of Court. Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff Dept and Not leave State of WI. Def. makes statement.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
